intro: Miconia cercaphora subsp. canelosana, commonly known as the Canelosana miconia, is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland and montane forests. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
